org.apache.hama.graph

Class Vertex<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable,E extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hama.graph.Vertex<V,E,M>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Vertex ID object type
    E - Edge cost object type
    M - Vertex value object type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Comparable<VertexInterface<V,E,M>>, org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable, org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable<VertexInterface<V,E,M>>, VertexInterface<V,E,M>

    public abstract class Vertex<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable,E extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>
extends Object
implements VertexInterface<V,E,M>
    Vertex is a abstract definition of Google Pregel Vertex. For implementing a graph application, one must implement a sub-class of Vertex and define, the message passing and message processing for each vertex. Every vertex should be assigned an ID. This ID object should obey the equals-hashcode contract and would be used for partitioning. The edges for a vertex could be accessed and modified using the getEdges() call. The self value of the vertex could be changed by setValue(Writable).

      • readState

        public void readState(DataInput in)
               throws IOException
        Read the state of the vertex from the input stream. The framework would have already constructed and loaded the vertex-id, edges and voteToHalt state. This function is essential if there is any more properties of vertex to be read from.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • writeState

        public void writeState(DataOutput out)
                throws IOException
        Writes the state of vertex to the output stream. The framework writes the vertex and edge information to the output stream. This function could be used to save the state variable of the vertex added in the implementation of object.
        Throws:
        IOException

        Throws:

      • getAggregatedValue

        public M getAggregatedValue(int index)
        Get the last aggregated value of the defined aggregator, null if nothing was configured or not returned a result. You have to supply an index, the index is defined by the order you set the aggregator classes in GraphJob.setAggregatorClass(Class...). Index is starting at zero, so if you have a single aggregator you can retrieve it via GraphJobRunner.getLastAggregatedValue(int)(0).
        Specified by:
        getAggregatedValue in interface VertexInterface<V extends org.apache.hadoop.io.WritableComparable,E extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable,M extends org.apache.hadoop.io.Writable>

      • getNumLastAggregatedVertices

        public org.apache.hadoop.io.IntWritable getNumLastAggregatedVertices(int index)
        Get the number of aggregated vertices in the last superstep. Or null if no aggregator is available.You have to supply an index, the index is defined by the order you set the aggregator classes in GraphJob.setAggregatorClass(Class...). Index is starting at zero, so if you have a single aggregator you can retrieve it via getNumLastAggregatedVertices(int)(0).
